chunks.en: openai launched o3-mini
https://openai.com/index/openai-o3-mini/
Since DeepSeek hasn't revealed when they'll release new models, they've been holding back updates, slowly releasing them, and even adopting NVIDIA's tactics.
Competition is best for users. I hope more powerful, open-source models become available in the future.
Try not to provide training data to OpenAI.
No matter how much it grows, it refuses to open-source even a slightly outdated model from last year, greedily hoarding resources and occasionally undermining intelligence with underhanded moves.
It's Scrooge-like.
I noticed free users can experience it by clicking 'reason' in the input box. Is this a countermove against DeepSeek?
@randychoi LiveBench maybe?
Is o3minihigh stronger than the current o1?

chunks.en: As part of this upgrade, weâ€™re tripling the rate limit for Plus and Team users from 50 messages per day with o1-mini to 150 messages per day with o3-mini. A 150-message daily limit for a small model. It's Scrooge + Shylock for subscribers. ğŸ˜‚

chunks.en: @ovtfkw According to LiveBeach data, o1 has the strongest overall capabilities. The translation capacity of o3 mini high is inferior to 4o's. o1 mini high has the best programming capability.
closeai: Scrooge + Shylock
@dji38838c But in OpenAI's own report here I saw that o3 mini has the strongest math capabilities. https://openai.com/index/openai-o3-mini/

chunks.en: #10 @466162659 As a free user with o3-mini enabled for inference, I asked: 'Which is larger, 3.11 or 3.9? Comparing their sizes, 3.11 is slightly larger. This difference may be negligible but highlights the importance of refinement.' Comparing the two values, clearly 3.11 is greater than 3.9. 3.11 is larger than 3.9.
Thanks to DeepSeek ~
Thanks to DeepSeek. Hope to get cheaper ChatGPT access in the future.
openai: Well, I did it earlier, but the competitors beat me to the punch.

chunks.en: o3 min high:@xbox360 When comparing these two numbers: first look at the integer parts. 3.11 has an integer part of 3; 3.9 also is 3. Since the integer parts are equal, compare the decimal parts. 3.11 has 0.11 as its decimal part; 3.9's is 0.9 (written as 0.90). Clearly, 0.90 > 0.11. Therefore, 3.9 is greater than 3.11.
